title: Loma Larga 2012 Unfiltered Syrah (Casablanca Valley)
description: Juniper aromas rule the nose on this cool-climate herbaceous Syrah. In the mouth, this is pulling and tannic, with a hard grind of gravel. Black-fruit flavors are narrow and bounce between eucalyptus and chocolate. Those same chocolaty green flavors control the finish.

title: Marrenon 2013 Sépia Red (Luberon)
description: There's plenty of easygoing red and black fruit flavor here, but the classic Mediterranean garrigue—rosemary, lavender and thyme—is central to this bold, full-bodied red. Crisp red-cherry and blackberry flavors are fresh and primary still, marked by vibrant acidity and firm, fine-grained tannins that frame the finish.

title: Muscardini 2013 Gracie Creek Vineyards Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: Candied cherry flavors are brashly ripe and juicy in this simple effort, the structure moderate and the texture oaky and tannic. Meat, black licorice and blackberry jam meld along a density that's hard to shake through the big finish.

title: Poggio Torselli 2015  Chianti Classico
description: This 85% Sangiovese and 15% Merlot blend opens with aromas of underbrush, red plum and baking spice. On the palate, clove and licorice notes accent a black cherry core while polished tannins provide the framework. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Polkura 2014 GSM + T Red (Marchigue)
description: This dark plush blend of Syrah and Grenache with smaller amounts of Mourvèdre and Tempranillo gets rolling with soft stewed berry aromas and flavors of prune and chocolate. A sweet pastry flavor dominates a short finish. Enjoy this for its ripe chewy lushness.

title: Rémy Ferbras 2015 Red (Rasteau)
description: Rustic notes of moss and freshly tilled soil mingle into fresh cassis and cherry in this plush but savory wine. It's rich and languorous in mouthfeel but bold, tacky tannins lend a dark, bitter tone to the finish.

title: Steele 2016 Pinot Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Tightly wound aromas of lemon skin meet with hints of toast and pecan wood on the nose of this bottling from Bien Nacido Vineyard. Mandarin pith, lemon rind and toasty croissant flavors show on the subtle palate.

title: The Federalist 2015 Zinfandel (Mendocino)
description: This full-bodied wine packs in ripe dark-fruit flavors of blackberry and boysenberry, and has smoky oaky accents to add some welcome complexity. Adding in 3% Cabernet Sauvignon, 2% Malbec and 2% Merlot accounts for some of that complexity. The wine is concentrated and mouth filling in texture without being too tannic.

title: Tower 15 2015 The Jetty Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This blend of 50% Grenache, 29% Syrah, 14% Carignane and 7% Cinsault is a versatile and well-priced table wine for all occasions. Aromas of hibiscus, berry, cola, rose petal and pine smoke lead into a palate where bay leaf and pepper hold up the red fruit.

title: Ventisquero 2013 Vertice Apalta Vineyard Carmenère-Syrah (Colchagua Valley)
description: Aromas of coffee grounds and murky earth cast a shadow over the nose of this Carmenère-Syrah blend. In the mouth, this is wiry and tough, and arguably a bit raw and thin. Herbal plum and currant flavors finish edgy and with abrasive tannins.

title: Viña Tarapacá 2014 Gran Reserva Made with Organically Grown Grapes Red (Maipo Valley)
description: Spicy plum and red-berry aromas are floral. This organic blend is quite hard and tannic, which makes plum and currant flavors seem rough. A scratchy rubbing finish is intense, with an herbaceous note.
designation: Gran Reserva Made with Organically Grown Grapes

title: Aiola 2014  Chianti Classico
description: You'll find aromas of violet, leather and a whiff of game on this approachable red. The sleek palate delivers raspberry, clove and white pepper alongside lively tannins and fresh acidity. Enjoy though 2022.

title: Arboleda 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Aconcagua Valley)
description: A classic Chilean Cabernet nose of dark-fruit aromas, wood spice and tar introduces a weighty palate with raw tannins. Savory, barrel-heavy flavors of berry fruits finish with a monotone taste and character of resiny oak.

title: Cherry Pie 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County-Monterey County-Santa Barbara County)
description: This is a fresh light spicy wine that's well balanced and flavorful without overdoing the body or extract. It blends red cherry, cinnamon, vanilla and strawberry and has good acidity and a touch of tannin to heighten the mouthfeel.

title: Craggy Range 2015 Te Kahu Gimblett Gravels Red (Hawke's Bay)
description: There's plenty of oak on this full-bodied Bordeaux blend in the form of cedar spice, dusting polish and Dr. Pepper, but it's balanced by juicy blackberries, florals, and the signature Gimblett Gravels stoniness. Lively acidity lifts the powerful, grainy tannins out of broody beast territory. This should age nicely to boot. Drink now–2027.

title: Dancing Bull 2015 Zinfandel (California)
description: Hints of vanilla bean and maple bar in the aroma make this full-bodied wine seem more sweet than it is, because it responds on the palate with mouth-filling fruit, moderately firm acidity and tannins. It finishes nicely dry, quite fruity and generous.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2016 Rava Blackjack Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Monterey)
description: Crisp Anjou pear, white flowers, lime zest and chalk show on the nose of this bottling. There's a great interplay between the high acid and tannic grip on the sip, where ripe Asian pear and red-apple flavors slide into a squeaky, taut finish.

title: Domaine des Nugues 2016  Beaujolais-Villages
description: This is a ripe and generous wine from a well-regarded producer. It is rich with red berries and structured with a series of fine tannins and acidity. It offers weight, plenty of fruit and is ready to drink.

title: Domaine des Terres Dorées 2016 L'Ancien  (Beaujolais)
description: This wine is ripe, softly structured and ready to drink. Red berres and acidity dominate, smoothed by wood aging in large barrels. It is fruity, with a crisp aftertaste.

title: Château Gaillard 2016  Morgon
description: This structured, firm wine is produced from 65-year-old vines. Tannins and juicy acidity support the red-berry flavors and crisp texture. This fruity wine has the tannins to age further. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Barone Ricasoli 2015 Brolio  (Chianti Classico)
description: Made with 80% Sangiovese, 15% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, this has aromas of violet, red-skinned berry and underbrush. The bright palate offers ripe raspberry, red cherry and a sprinkling of white pepper alongside fine-grained tannins.

title: Benmarl 2015 Merlot (North Fork of Long Island)
description: Engaging on the nose in racy red cherry and currant, a bit of funk along with smoke and clove offer some intrigue. Grippy, sandy tannins, crisp acidity and a medium body carry similar flavors, with warm spices and toast leading to a cranberry-tannin finish.

title: Bindi Sergardi 2013 Mocenni Gran Selezione  (Chianti Classico)
description: French oak, spiced plum, coconut and blue flower aromas lead the nose. On the palate, fine-grained tannins underscore oak-driven spice, prune, vanilla and dried black cherry. Drink sooner rather than later to catch the remaining fruit.

title: Black Elephant 2015 Timothy White (Franschhoek)
description: A blend of 33% Chenin Blanc, 33% Sémillon, 25% Sauvignon Blanc and 9% viognier, this is ripe and forward in fruit tones. Toasted apple, melon rind, orange oil and yellow flowers abound, framed by just enough acidity to counter the palate's opulence. Drink now.

title: Brander 2016 Merlot (Los Olivos District)
description: This twist-top bottling is fun and fresh, perfect with a light chill. Aromas of red plums, strawberries, carnations and cola lead into a zippy palate full of plum and more strawberry fruit.

title: Castello di Monterinaldi 2014 Riserva  (Chianti Classico)
description: Moist underbrush, woodland berry, blue flower and dark culinary spice aromas delicately guide the nose. The poised, ethereal palate offers succulent sour cherry, coffee bean and a hint of clove while supple tannins and firm acidity offer lithe support. Drink through 2021.

title: Château Saint-Louis la Perdrix 2015 La Dernière Croisade Red (Costières de Nîmes)
description: Black plum and cherry flavors are plush and round on the nose and palate of this full-bodied wine. It's juicy and supple yet briskly balanced by fresh acidity and a frame of ripe, fine-grained tannins.

title: Domaine de Bel-Air 2016 Briante  (Brouilly)
description: This wine is soft, with ripe red fruit and the lightest touch of tannins. It's smooth, open and generous. A succulent, juicy character marks the red-cherry fruit and balanced acidity. Drink now.

title: 786 Wines 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Good depth and concentration lift this medium-bodied and well-balanced wine well above the average. It has complex fruit flavors, light touches of vanilla and butter, and a velvety smooth texture supported by just enough acidity to keep it lively.

title: Ana 2016 Pinot Noir (Marlborough)
description: This is a silky Pinot cloaked in fine, savory tannins and fresh acidity with stalky, cherry cola, red fruit and floral notes. There's a lovely tension in this wine that keeps you going back for more.
